com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.utilities

Class DisplayManagerUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmactips.utilities.DisplayManagerUtilities

  • public class DisplayManagerUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps to determine the screen height and width in Density Pixels (DP) Created by pmacdowell on 8/15/2016.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayManagerUtilities

        public DisplayManagerUtilities(android.content.Context context)
        This will get the width and height of the screen in DP. This constructor is used to define the instance variables and set them while the other methods are used as accessor/ getters.
        Parameters:
        context - Context from activity would be 'this' and from fragment would be 'getActivity()'

      • getScalablePixelTextSize

        public float getScalablePixelTextSize(int baseSize)
        Get scaled density SP for setting textviews. You would pass in a base number (IE 20)
        Parameters:
        baseSize - Base number for test size in pixels
        Returns:
        float adjusted text size in SP (scalable pixels)

      • convertPixelsToDp

        public float convertPixelsToDp(float px)
        This method converts device specific pixels to densityRatio independent pixels.
        Parameters:
        px - A value in px (pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into db
        Returns:
        A float value to represent dp equivalent to px value

      • convertDpToPixel

        public float convertDpToPixel(float dp)
        This method converts dp unit to equivalent pixels, depending on device densityRatio.
        Parameters:
        dp - A value in dp (densityRatio independent pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into pixels
        Returns:
        A float value to represent px equivalent to dp depending on device densityRatio

      • getWidthRadius

        public float getWidthRadius()
        Builds and returns the radius of the screen for a circle to be drawn in the center. If you want to make this smaller, simply divide it by X%
        Returns:

      • opacityPercent

        public static int opacityPercent(float percent)
        Calculates the % opacity I want to use. higher number means less see-through
        Parameters:
        percent - % to convert, 0 means transparent, 100 means completely blocking background
        Returns:
        int, used like this, view.getBackground().setAlpha(opacityPercent(55));

        Returns:

      • convertToPixels

        public float convertToPixels(DisplayManagerUtilities.ComplexUnits unit,
                             float value)
        Get a pixels value for the dimension passed.
        Parameters:
        unit - Unit of measurement: COMPLEX_UNIT_PX = 0; == Raw Pixels COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP = 1; == Device Independent Pixel (DP) COMPLEX_UNIT_SP = 2; == Scaled Pixels COMPLEX_UNIT_PT = 3; == Points COMPLEX_UNIT_IN = 4; == Inches COMPLEX_UNIT_MM = 5; == Millimeters TypedValue.TYPE_DIMENSION
        value - Value to convert
        Returns:
        float, in pixels, of converted value

      • convertToPixels

        public float convertToPixels(int unit,
                             float value)
        Overloaded method.
        Parameters:
        unit - TypedValue
        value - Value to convert
        Returns:
        float, in pixels, of converted value

        public android.graphics.Point getNavigationBarSize()
        Gets the size of the navigation bar (bar at the bottom with the back, home, menu options)
        Returns:
        Point X is the width, Y is the height

      • getAppUsableScreenSize

        public android.graphics.Point getAppUsableScreenSize()
        Gets the useable screen size. This would be applicable if there were an action bar covering an area, which reduces usable screen size
        Returns:
        Point X is the width, Y is the height
